Fields.DialogueText: Captain, I have a letter for you.
I... think it comes from a Belle.
Interesting. Thank you, Guzman.

Fields.MenuText: This is some fancy stationery. Odd.
Do you think it's important?
I wonder what this could be about.

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, I think I got some grease on the pretty paper.
I imagine it would be, coming from a Belle.
Your guess is as good as mine, Captain.
*ALARM*
Ah, what's this now?
Guzman, prepare for battle. The letter will have to wait.
@BATTLE
Now let me see what this is about.
"Dear Kanchou, I hope this letter finds you in good health and high spirits. I am writing you on this day because it has come to my attention that Chikuma is now in your charge."
"Allow me to begin by expressing my faith in Chikuma as a warrior. Dedicated, ambitious, highly skilled, and committed to the honor of the fleet, I believe you have done well to recruit her."
"This said, I must caution you. Chikuma bubbles with youthful spirit. I have found this spirit refreshing, but I remain concerned with her ability to cope with the realities of war."
"I ask that you pay special attention to her for this reason. Insofar as it is in your power, please assure that Chikuma retains some of her youthful exuberance."
"More urgently still, please do what you can to assure that she does not turn radically away from herself in these times of desperation."
"If you work together, you shall prevail. Take care of yourself. With honor, Takao."
Is it bad news?

Fields.MenuText: I don't know.
Just Belle family drama.
Fan mail. I'm used to it.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll let Takao know her message has been received. That should be the end of it.
Understood.
Dismissed, Lieutenant.
Lieutenant Guzman, come here.
What's the matter, Captain?
Do you hear that sound? Check the deck for injuries.
Aye.
Well, is it bad?
No, Captain - we seem to have no injuries. That sound there is the crew singing.

Fields.MenuText: They call that singing?
There must be a strange echo, because it sounded like tortured groans to me.
How could they be singing after a battle like that?

Fields.DialogueText: It's Chikuma. She's leading them in song.
I think Chikuma is just making up the song as she goes along. The song certainly doesn't seem very polished.
It's Chikuma. She has everyone in good spirits.
Well, morale seems high. I suppose I have nothing to complain about.
... You're sure that's--
Positive.
Huh.
@BATTLE
Chikuma, do you have a moment?
Hai! How may I be of service, dearest Kanchou?
Have I misspoken?

Fields.MenuText: I'm afraid we don't have that kind of familiarity yet.
Kanchou is more than adequate. It's better for the crew to see the standard procedure.
You just caught me off guard. No one else on board refers to me so... fondly.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh! Gomen nasai. I can refer to you simply as "Kanchou" if you'd like.
Of course, Kanchou.
Gomen nasai! I'm sorry if I made you uncomfortable! I'll refer to you simply as "Kanchou."
It's probably for the best.
Now, to my original point. Some of the crew members have mentioned that you have been eating nothing but rice.
Oh! Yes, I suppose that's true, Kanchou.
Is there something wrong with the food?
No, there's nothing wrong, Kanchou. Rice is simply what I'm most accustomed to eating. I wouldn't mind trying new things now and then, though.
*ALARM*
Ah, well, it looks like we have bigger fish to fry.
@BATTLE
Has anyone seen Chikuma?
As far as I know, no one has seen her since our drills earlier.
Where could she be?
Well, Captain, she may be in her private quarters. She's been spending a lot of time there.
Check, would you? If you find her, tell her to report to me.
Yes, Captain.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Haha!

Fields.MenuText: Chikuma? Where have you been?
Stay right there, Chikuma. We need to talk.
Great work out there, Chikuma.

Fields.DialogueText: I was fighting, of course. Wasn't it exciting?
Okay, okay...
Thanks, Kanchou! It is my duty and my pleasure.
I wanted to talk to you. But, first, I want to know how I can find you to talk in the future.
Just call my name, Kanchou. I'll be there.
What the...? Chikuma? Where did she go?
She vanished.
Belles...
Have you seen Chikuma, Guzman? I still need to speak with her.
I'm afraid she disappeared after drills, again.
Could she have returned to her quarters? What does she spend so much time doing in there?
Please, track her down for me, would you?
I will if you want, but remember, she said that you could just call her, Captain.
I'm a little dubious on that point. Chikuma so often has her head in the clouds, I'm not sure she'll hear me.
Maybe you should just take her word for it, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Okay, here it goes.
I guess I'll try it just to prove you wrong.
I hope this works.

Fields.DialogueText: Chikuma!
Chikuma!
Chikuma!
Ohayou, Kanchou. How can I help you?
Woah.
... Okay. I'm impressed.
*ALARM*
For now, just help me defeat these incoming Morganas.
Hai! Of course, Kanchou! For the honor of the fleet.
@BATTLE
Chikuma?
Hello, Kanchou!
Your sudden appearances really are... something else.
Is this about the rice again, Kanchou?
No, not really.
What is it then, Kanchou?
I've heard from the crew that you're spending a lot of time in your quarters.
Oh, have I been? Where does the time go?

Fields.MenuText: What are you doing in there?
I understand. Sometimes time alone can be beneficial.
Personally, I hate being cooped up for too long.

Fields.DialogueText: I agree. But I've actually been working on something, recently.
Well, there is something I've been working on recently.
Don't misunderstand, I love spending time with the crew. But I have been spending time alone to work on... something.
What is it you're working on?
I would rather show you than talk about it, but it will be better if you wait until I've finished.
That's certainly fair, if you're not using fleet resources. But -
*ALARM*
Let's get to the bridge.
@BATTLE
Chikuma?
Hai.
What's our status?
We'll live to fight another day, Kanchou.
Kanchou, I've actually been meaning to ask you something,

Fields.MenuText: What is it, Chikuma?
Have you? Please, proceed.
Are you feeling well, Chikuma?

Fields.DialogueText: I can't help but notice that you seem a little... overly concerned with me.
I want to know why you seem to be so worried about every little thing I do.
Yes. Kanchou, of course. But you... you seem to be constantly worried over my state of being.
*ALARM*
Chikuma, we'll have to talk about this another time.
Of course, Kanchou...
@BATTLE
Chikuma?
Kanchou! Ohayou gozaimasu!
I wanted to finish our conversation from earlier.

Fields.MenuText: This is awkward, but - I was asked to keep an eye on you by another Belle.
I *was* worried about you - but you're proving I don't have to be.
I'm worried about you, Chikuma.

Fields.DialogueText: Is that so?
You have enough responsibilities - concern over my welfare shouldn't be one of them.
You... you are?
*ALARM*
Morganas. Tattered flags on approach, Captain.
Of course they are.
We have to put this conversation off again, Chikuma.
We can save it for later, Kanchou. For victory.
@BATTLE
She was worried about the effect the war might have on you.
*ALARM*
Almost in firing range. Anything I need to know, Chikuma?
Don't worry. We are all with you!
@BATTLE
Hey, Kanchou...
Chikuma, excellent work out there.
Thank you, but I wanted to tell you...
Yes?
I understand that you are concerned about me. I understand my age could be a detriment in this war.
But please, let me assure you, I'm perfectly capable of taking care of myself.

Fields.MenuText: If you're asking for more space and more trust... yeah, I'd say you've earned it.
I'd noticed. Your work so far has been exemplary.
Sure. But I'm your captain, and it's my responsibility to look out for you.

Fields.DialogueText: I've very grateful, Kanchou. Arigatō.
Ah, thank you, Kanchou. Arigatō!
Well, I suppose I can understand that.
I hope we've cleared the air a little.
Hai. It does seem a little fresher now.
That said, you don't have to impress me, and you shouldn't hesitate to tell me if you think I'm crowding you.
Kanchou! Ohayou gozaimasu!
Good morning, Chikuma. You seem... almost giddy.
Bingo! Kanchou, guess what?

Fields.MenuText: Are you finally ready to show me what you've been working on in your quarters?
Please don't try to make me sing with the crew.
You spotted a mermaid off the bow?

Fields.DialogueText: As a matter of fact... yes.
Haha! Not today, at least.
What? No...
I'll show you. Come with me.
All right...
It's just in here.
Your quarters are very organized, Chikuma, but... what's that smell?
Look here.
These... these are incredible. These prints are what you have been working on?
Yes! They're woodblock prints. It's a traditional Japanese art form. I apologize for the smell.
They're unbelievable. The detail... a girl with her feet in sea and her hands in the sky. A sea bird. A kitten. Here are... oh goodness. These are all of the ships in the IJN.
I had no idea you were an artist. How long have you been doing this?
Well, I have been working on these since the last few battles.
But how long have you been training in the art of woodblock printing?
Oh, only since I took you on as my kanchou.
That's amazing, Chikuma. Thank you for sharing these with me.
Of course, Kanchou!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Damn.
Seconded. That's more of them than we were led to expect.
@BATTLE
Captain! We have several injured crew members on deck.
Let's start getting the injured crew to the sickbay. Where is Chikuma?
I haven't seen her since the battle. Don't worry, though - I'll oversee the transportation of the injured to sick bay at once.
Wait. Who's that over there?
That one there, laying on the ground? That's Kishibe, Captain. He's one of the floatplane pilots.
Let's get to him right away. He's in bad shape.
Yes, come on.

Fields.MenuText: Kishibe, can you hear me?
Hey, wake up.
Do you know where you are? What year is it?

Fields.DialogueText: ...eer.
...bah.
We need a medic over here! Now!
Chikuma?
Chikuma, where have you been?
I've been in the infirmary, Kanchou.
All this time? You must be wrecked.

Fields.MenuText: Chikuma, what is it?
Chikuma, you look like you saw a ghost.
Oh no. Chikuma...

Fields.DialogueText: The pilot, Kishibe - he may not survive his injuries.
I hope Kishibe does not become a ghost. He is very badly wounded.
There is a serious injury among the crew. Kishibe might not survive.
Chikuma? Where did she go?
*ALARM*
I wonder if this is what Takao was afraid of.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
It just never lets up, does it?
Ready guns! If the Morgana talks to us, try to ignore her!
@BATTLE
Captain, we have more injuries.
Understood. Tell me where you need an extra set of hands, and let's get them to the infirmary.
We're out of beds, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Then we'll have to set up makeshift bedding on the floor.
Double up the beds, then.
Damn it. Just do whatever you can.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain.
Yes, Captain. I think they should all fit.
I'll work on it.
Chikuma?
*sigh*
Chikuma!
Chikuma?
Yes, Kanchou?
There you are.

Fields.MenuText: You seemed shaken last I saw you. How are you now?
Well, I see now that I was right to be worried about you.
You're fine now, right?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm okay, Kanchou. I promise.
I will keep my composure in the future, Kanchou. I won't let it happen again.
Hai. I'm fine now. I was just worried about the some of the injured crew members.
The crew's morale is dangerously low right now, Chikuma. No one is better equipped for raising their spirits than you.
Do you think you can help them?
Hai! I know I can!
*ALARM*
Okay, it's time for action.
I'm ready.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
All hands to battle stations! This is not a drill!
Hold on tight, Guzman. I think the fun's about to start.
@BATTLE
Lieutenant Guzman, how do things look?
I'll have specifics in a few minutes, Captain. The short version is that we're not going to sink, and the infirmary isn't overwhelmed.
I'll take it.
Chikuma?
Hai?
Our last battle was a success, and based on what I'm hearing from the crew, morale is improving as well. You played an integral role in both those happenings.
Thank you for your dedication.
Of course, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Let's see to the crew. I'm sure we can raise their spirits even higher.
Perhaps you should head to the sickbay. I know the injured are never happier than when you're with them.
Maybe now is a good time for you to get the crew together for another victory song.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai. I'm excited to help, Kanchou.
Of course, Kanchou. I'm always honored to do whatever I can for them.
I think it's a good time for that too, Kanchou.
Captain?
Yes?
I'm afraid I come with some bad news. It's Kishibe.
The injured pilot in critical condition? Don't tell me he's...
He's alive. Barely. If you can call him that.
What do you mean?
He won't respond to anything. He's breathing and his heart beats, but he's just... not there.
So, a coma, then?
No, Captain. I wouldn't say that. He blinks. He moves some. He can eat of his own volition. It's just that he doesn't seem to have any life behind his eyes.

Fields.MenuText: Some Morgana weapon, you think?
I know men came out of the trenches like this in the last war. I'm not giving up on him yet.
If he's eating, he's still in there. Have a little faith.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know. I've never seen a thing like it.
I don't know. This is... there's just something really wrong, Captain.
I'll... try, Captain.
*ALARM*
Prepare for battle, Lieutenant.
@BATTLE
Chikuma?
Hello, Kanchou.
Chikuma, you look... are you okay?
Hai. Of course, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure? It looks like you haven't slept a wink.
I can't say I believe you.
I guess I'll take your word for it. This time.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, please, tell me why you called me here.
Why did you want to speak to me?
Thank you.
I wanted to ask if you've heard about Kishibe's condition.
Hai. I've heard.
I know things look bad, but he hasn't given up yet. We can't either.
Mm.
*ALARM*
Morganas, Captain. They're coming in fast.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
All hands to battle stations! This is not a drill!
Come on, Funayūrei. Just a little closer...
@BATTLE
Chikuma?
Not again. Where has she gone now?
Captain, Chikuma has gone to her quarters. She won't come out.

Fields.MenuText: I need to speak with her. We have to discuss the damage from that last battle.
We should see if she's okay.
Ah, hell. That's just what we need right now.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain. I'll try her room again.
I think that's wise. I'll go to her quarters.
Perhaps we should check on her. I'll go now.
Captain, I think there's something you should see.
She's off duty, Captain.
I know. But still--
What am I missing?
It's over here?
Yes, Captain. Take a peek into Chikuma's quarters.
Look at the pictures, the prints.

Fields.MenuText: Those are new. It looks like the subjects of Chikuma's woodblock prints have changed... significantly.
God, her new prints depict the most disturbing images.
The prints used to be of the ocean, and birds, and kittens. Now it's all gore and... strange eyes.

Fields.DialogueText: I was surprised to see that coming from the mind of young Chikuma. I think it's a very bad sign. Those eyes... they're so strange.
Aye. And look at those strange eyes.
I could hardly believe Chikuma was capable of making these.
Is she in there still?
Hard to tell. It's so dark.
*ALARM*
We need to think of something... some way to help her.
@BATTLE
Those eyes...
I've seen them before.
Captain?
Captain.
Oh, yes? Sorry, Guzman, I didn't see you there.
You look like you've seen a ghost, Captain.
To tell you the truth, I've been thinking about what we saw in Chikuma's quarters.
*ALARM*
We'll discuss this later.
@BATTLE
What was it you were saying before the battle, Captain?
It was those eyes in her prints. I didn't realize it at first, but I have seen them before.
In all honesty, Captain, I... believe I've seen them before as well.
In your dreams?
Yes.
Captain.  I have some more strange news. The whole crew says they have been experiencing nightmares.
The whole crew?
Everyone I spoke with, yes. And they say that Chikuma's prints depict the things they see in those nightmares.
But how is Chikuma able to see inside our heads?
She's the ship. Maybe we are the ones inside her head.

Fields.MenuText: We need to speak to Chikuma.
I wonder if this has anything to do with Kishibe. Chikuma may have more insight.
Dammit. Somebody give me a threat I can just shoot.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain. I agree.
It seems possible. That seems to have been the main trigger for Chikuma's withdrawal...
I'm pretty sure they're around here too, Captain.
Right. Let's go back to her quarters.
@BATTLE
Captain. The door to Chikuma's quarters...
I see it. Careful - I don't think that black stuff is smoke.
It's... darkness, of some sort. *cough* Somehow it's spilling out from under the door. *hack*
Guzman, are you all right?
Captain, don't breathe... it in. Back... away.
Chikuma!
Guzman, stay behind and keep low. I'll be back for you.
Chikuma!
Kanchou...

Fields.MenuText: Chikuma, what is going on?
You need to stop this fog, Chikuma.
Chikuma, get away from that fog. It's toxic.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, it's almost done.
I'm trying, Kanchou. But it must be released.
No, Kanchou. It must be released.
We need you, Chikuma. I need you. Whatever you're going through, I promise, we'll be here for you, through all of it.
... And it's done.
The air... it's clearing.
*ALARM*
Morganas, now?
Don't worry, Kanchou. We can do it.
@BATTLE
*cough* Captain... I don't think I can go-- *hack*
Good work during that last battle, Chikuma.
I was only doing my duty, Kanchou. For now, though, we must see to Lieutenant Guzman.
You're right. Let's go.
Lieutenant Guzman?
Uh...
Guzman, can you speak?
Yes... yes, I'm just a little weak. But I think I'll be fine.
What a relief.
Let me help you up, Lieutenant Guzman.
Thank you, Chikuma.

Fields.MenuText: Chikuma, what was that fog? Was that some kind of Morgana mist?
What was making Guzman sick?
You seem so much better now, Chikuma. What happened?

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe it was, in a sense. The Funayūrei have been attacking us, Kanchou, secretly. I had to gather up their essence and banish it.
It was the fog, Kanchou. It was... there was an evil on this ship, and the fog came at the end, as I exorcised it.
The Funayūrei have been attacking us, Kanchou, secretly. I had to gather up their essence and banish it. And now I think it's done!
*ALARM*
I have more questions, Chikuma. Can we talk later?
Hai! Of course, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
Chikuma?
Ohayou!
Chikuma, you seem so happy again. I'm glad.
Hai. I have learned quite a bit as well, in fact.
I still have so many questions for you.
I'm happy to answer them, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Where were the nightmares coming from? That was a Morgana attack?
Why did you start making those terrifying prints?
How did you release the fog?

Fields.DialogueText: It's hard to say, Kanchou. Because the ship and I are one, I feel like the crew is part of me when they are aboard. The dreams were mine, and ours.
I made the prints to excise the images from my mind. It was one step in banishing the Funayūrei... curse... from the ship.
Ah. I created the prints as a form of... banishing seal. But as I worked on them, the Funayūrei's influence gathered in opposition. When I finished the last of the prints, it finally released.
So, those terrifying prints... served a purpose?
Hai! I made them to seal the Funayūrei magi... attack away from the ship.
Captain, I have excellent news. The pilot, Kishibe, has come to. He's speaking and conscious.
This is great news! Chikuma, did you do this somehow?
Hai. I hope so. In many ways, he was this attack's first victim. I hope he may now be free from it.
@BATTLE

Hai. It was almost a kind of infection, I think. The Funayūrei used a kind of... contaminated weapon on Kishibe's airplane, and when we allowed it onboard they were able to attack us in this strange, evil way.
I was able to remove the shell that originally caused the problem, but by then these dark forces were already in my dreams - all our dreams.
Wait. Were you the target, or the crew? Or...?
Chikuma, that's-
*ALARM*
Remind me to compliment you later.
Hai!
Chikuma?
Kanchou. Ohayou!
I have some things to speak to you about.
Captain, Chikuma-sama...
Kishibe! You've recovered.
Yes, I wanted to thank you both for the parts you played in my recovery. I'm... I'm so proud to be part of this crew.
*ALARM*
Probably for the best. I didn't have anything else to say, and I'm terrible at small talk.
Chikuma, later on we should talk in private. Let's meet in my quarters.
@BATTLE
What is it, Kanchou?
Well, first, I wanted to tell you that I'm really impressed with your abilities. Your control of this ship and your personal skills have both proven invaluable.
I may have doubted you, but if it wasn't for you, we might have lost some of the crew. Your presence really is something special.
Kanchou... I... thank you. I realize now how lucky I am to have a kanchou who would do so much to make sure that I'm well.
In the end, everything you've done has been helpful to me. It's obvious that you care about this vessel... and me.

Fields.MenuText: Thank you for that, Chikuma. I think we make a great team.
Chikuma, I do care about you. I don't know what I'd do without you.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai! We make an excellent team. I'm excited to see where go next.
I care about you too, Kanchou. Our bond really is a special one.
